holidays.name: National Honesty Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to encouraging honesty and straightforward communication, celebrated by telling the truth‚Äîeven when it's hard!
holidays.origin: Started in 1991 by M. Hirsh Goldberg, a former U.S. Senate reporter, to combat habitual dishonesty in society.
holidays.funFact: Despite its theme, National Honesty Day originated as a tongue-in-cheek response to April Fool's Day, which is all about tricks and fibs.

holidays.name: International Jazz Day
holidays.description: A global celebration of jazz music's rich history and cultural impact, promoting peace and unity through the power of jazz.
holidays.origin: Established in 2011 by UNESCO to highlight jazz's role in dialogue and cooperation among people.
holidays.funFact: Jazz was once called 'the devil's music' before it became an international symbol of freedom and creativity.

holidays.name: Hairball Awareness Day
holidays.description: A quirky day for cat owners to acknowledge the struggles of dealing with those pesky hairballs their feline friends cough up.
holidays.origin: An unofficial internet holiday created by cat lovers to share tips and humorous stories about hairballs.
holidays.funFact: Cats can produce up to 15 hairballs a year, and some cats may even develop 'hairball kits' with special treats to help reduce them.

holidays.name: National Bubble Tea Day
holidays.description: A delicious day celebrating bubble tea, the sweet, chewy drink originating from Taiwan, famous for its tapioca pearls.
holidays.origin: Celebrated unofficially by bubble tea fans and shops, with no official origin but gaining popularity worldwide as the drink spread.
holidays.funFact: The tapioca pearls in bubble tea are sometimes called 'boba,' originating from a Taiwanese slang word meaning 'big breasts,' referring to their round shape.
